My industrial placement year at Unisys was the third year of my four year sandwich degree course.
The year's placement gave me my first insight into the 'real' world of work and commercial realities.
The intention of the year was to get involved in a broad variety of projects to give an overview of the IT industry in general.
The department of Unisys that I was involved in was the 'Office Automation' department, whose responsibilities covered basic networked personal computers, running word processing and spreadsheet packages, right through to large document processing machines used by high volume cheque processing departments, typically of banks. As such, the department had many clients within the City of London.
I worked with more senior full-time employees of the company - and occasionally on my own - implementing office automation solutions. During my time at Unisys, I ran a course on the use of a bespoke banking software system for the staff of a major high street bank.
